dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Combine Attributes tool merges feature attributes from two or more polyline feature classes into a single feature class.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kelly Whitehead, Jesse Langdon, South Fork Research, Inc.

tool.name: CombineAttributesTool

param.name: InputFCList
param.dialogReference: Polyline feature classes representing linear networks. Multiple inputs are allowed. Can be shapefiles or geodatabase feature classes.

param.name: InputFCBounding Polygon
param.displayname: Bounding or buffer polygon feature class
param.dialogReference: Polygon feature class that provides a spatial boundary for processing. The polygon should geographically contain all input networks. The polygon will contain the Thiessen polygons used to split the "To" line network based on the "From" networks. Stream networks that are located outside of this polygon boundary will not have attributes transferred. Can be a shapefile or geodatabase feature class.

param.name: InputBoolIsSegmented
param.dialogReference:
• Checked: the bounding polygon is divided based on the "From" line network. This reduces the amount of processing required to run the tool.

  • Unchecked: divde the bounding polygon into segments as part of the processing.

param.name: OutputFCCombinedNetwork
param.dialogReference: Polyline feature class which includes all merged attributes.

tool.summary: The Combine Attributes tool merges feature attributes from two or more polyline feature classes into a single feature class.
